connector.description: Send and receive messages from/to Apache Pulsar messaging system.

camel.source.path.persistence.name: camel.source.path.persistence
camel.source.path.persistence.description: Whether the topic is persistent or non-persistent One of: [persistent] [non-persistent]

camel.source.endpoint.ackGroupTimeMillis.name: camel.source.endpoint.ackGroupTimeMillis
camel.source.endpoint.ackGroupTimeMillis.description: Group the consumer acknowledgments for the specified time in milliseconds - defaults to 100

camel.source.endpoint.ackTimeoutMillis.name: camel.source.endpoint.ackTimeoutMillis
camel.source.endpoint.ackTimeoutMillis.description: Timeout for unacknowledged messages in milliseconds - defaults to 10000

camel.source.endpoint.allowManualAcknowl.name: camel.source.endpoint.allowManualAcknowledgement
camel.source.endpoint.allowManualAcknowl.description: Whether to allow manual message acknowledgements. If this option is enabled, then messages are not acknowledged automatically after successful route completion. Instead, an instance of PulsarMessageReceipt is stored as a header on the org.apache.camel.Exchange. Messages can then be acknowledged using PulsarMessageReceipt at any time before the ackTimeout occurs.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.consumerName.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerName
camel.source.endpoint.consumerName.description: Name of the consumer when subscription is EXCLUSIVE

camel.source.endpoint.consumerNamePrefix.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerNamePrefix
camel.source.endpoint.consumerNamePrefix.description: Prefix to add to consumer names when a SHARED or FAILOVER subscription is used

camel.source.endpoint.consumerQueueSize.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerQueueSize
camel.source.endpoint.consumerQueueSize.description: Size of the consumer queue - defaults to 10

camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterTopic.name: camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterTopic
camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterTopic.description: Name of the topic where the messages which fail maxRedeliverCount times will be sent. Note: if not set, default topic name will be topicName-subscriptionName-DLQ

camel.source.endpoint.maxRedeliverCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxRedeliverCount
camel.source.endpoint.maxRedeliverCount.description: Maximum number of times that a message will be redelivered before being sent to the dead letter queue. If this value is not set, no Dead Letter Policy will be created

camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionInitia.name: camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionInitialPosition
camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionInitia.description: Control the initial position in the topic of a newly created subscription. Default is latest message. One of: [EARLIEST] [LATEST]

camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionName.name: camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionName
camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionName.description: Name of the subscription to use

camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionTopics.name: camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionTopicsMode
camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionTopics.description: Determines to which topics this consumer should be subscribed to - Persistent, Non-Persistent, or both. Only used with pattern subscriptions. One of: [PersistentOnly] [NonPersistentOnly] [AllTopics]

camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionType.name: camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionType
camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionType.description: Type of the subscription EXCLUSIVESHAREDFAILOVERKEY_SHARED, defaults to EXCLUSIVE One of: [EXCLUSIVE] [SHARED] [FAILOVER] [KEY_SHARED]

camel.source.endpoint.topicsPattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.topicsPattern
camel.source.endpoint.topicsPattern.description: Whether the topic is a pattern (regular expression) that allows the consumer to subscribe to all matching topics in the namespace

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.pulsar.configuration.name: camel.component.pulsar.configuration
camel.component.pulsar.configuration.description: Allows to pre-configure the Pulsar component with common options that the endpoints will reuse.

camel.component.pulsar.ackGroupTimeMilli.name: camel.component.pulsar.ackGroupTimeMillis
camel.component.pulsar.ackGroupTimeMilli.description: Group the consumer acknowledgments for the specified time in milliseconds - defaults to 100

camel.component.pulsar.ackTimeoutMillis.name: camel.component.pulsar.ackTimeoutMillis
camel.component.pulsar.ackTimeoutMillis.description: Timeout for unacknowledged messages in milliseconds - defaults to 10000

camel.component.pulsar.allowManualAcknow.name: camel.component.pulsar.allowManualAcknowledgement
camel.component.pulsar.allowManualAcknow.description: Whether to allow manual message acknowledgements. If this option is enabled, then messages are not acknowledged automatically after successful route completion. Instead, an instance of PulsarMessageReceipt is stored as a header on the org.apache.camel.Exchange. Messages can then be acknowledged using PulsarMessageReceipt at any time before the ackTimeout occurs.

camel.component.pulsar.bridgeErrorHandle.name: camel.component.pulsar.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.pulsar.bridgeErrorHandle.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.pulsar.consumerName.name: camel.component.pulsar.consumerName
camel.component.pulsar.consumerName.description: Name of the consumer when subscription is EXCLUSIVE

camel.component.pulsar.consumerNamePrefi.name: camel.component.pulsar.consumerNamePrefix
camel.component.pulsar.consumerNamePrefi.description: Prefix to add to consumer names when a SHARED or FAILOVER subscription is used

camel.component.pulsar.consumerQueueSize.name: camel.component.pulsar.consumerQueueSize
camel.component.pulsar.consumerQueueSize.description: Size of the consumer queue - defaults to 10

camel.component.pulsar.deadLetterTopic.name: camel.component.pulsar.deadLetterTopic
camel.component.pulsar.deadLetterTopic.description: Name of the topic where the messages which fail maxRedeliverCount times will be sent. Note: if not set, default topic name will be topicName-subscriptionName-DLQ

camel.component.pulsar.maxRedeliverCount.name: camel.component.pulsar.maxRedeliverCount
camel.component.pulsar.maxRedeliverCount.description: Maximum number of times that a message will be redelivered before being sent to the dead letter queue. If this value is not set, no Dead Letter Policy will be created

camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionIniti.name: camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionInitialPosition
camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionIniti.description: Control the initial position in the topic of a newly created subscription. Default is latest message. One of: [EARLIEST] [LATEST]

camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionName.name: camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionName
camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionName.description: Name of the subscription to use

camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionTopic.name: camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionTopicsMode
camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionTopic.description: Determines to which topics this consumer should be subscribed to - Persistent, Non-Persistent, or both. Only used with pattern subscriptions. One of: [PersistentOnly] [NonPersistentOnly] [AllTopics]

camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionType.name: camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionType
camel.component.pulsar.subscriptionType.description: Type of the subscription EXCLUSIVESHAREDFAILOVERKEY_SHARED, defaults to EXCLUSIVE One of: [EXCLUSIVE] [SHARED] [FAILOVER] [KEY_SHARED]

camel.component.pulsar.topicsPattern.name: camel.component.pulsar.topicsPattern
camel.component.pulsar.topicsPattern.description: Whether the topic is a pattern (regular expression) that allows the consumer to subscribe to all matching topics in the namespace

camel.component.pulsar.pulsarMessageRece.name: camel.component.pulsar.pulsarMessageReceiptFactory
camel.component.pulsar.pulsarMessageRece.description: Provide a factory to create an alternate implementation of PulsarMessageReceipt.

camel.component.pulsar.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.pulsar.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.pulsar.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
